data.title: Clean and Convenient
data.text: Our stay was nice, ameneties near by were in walking distance and the hotel was in excellent condition. We had a great stay. The front desk staff was very helpful in finding us some places nearby to eat, and the environment was warm and inviting.

Pete Bauchle
General Manager
Lismore Hotel

data.title: Eau Clair place to stay.
data.text:
The best place to stay and dine. 
If you like the feel of a quality hotel, this place has great value for the price.  I've stayed at hotels and inns all over the world and I was very pleasantly surprised by what we found at the Double Tree Eau Claire.  Great warm cookies too!

owner_response.text:
Wow, 
Thank you for the great comments on The Lismore Hotel. We feel very proud of our hotel.
I will make sure I share these comments with my staff. 

Pete Bauchle
General Manager
The Lismore Hotel

data.title: Staying in the City
data.text: A true gem located in downtown Eau Claire, Wisconsin! The hotel is sleek and stylish, yet very comfortable. The staff is helpful, friendly and efficient. The food is fantastic and not your typical hotel fare. My room was clean and inviting. I truly enjoyed the entire experience and I plan on returning!

data.title: Beautiful hotel for great price
data.text: This remodeled hotel is beautiful and you can't tell that it's not new. The rooms were nice and we had a great view. We also enjoyed a drink at the restaurant and the menu looked amazing but we didn't have time to eat.   On the second floor they have a nice indoor outdoor bar which was also fun. The staff in both the hotel and restaurant were great.

data.title: Great business trip
data.text:
Have stayed in this hotel several times as a business traveler due to frequent business in Eau Claire. Very modern, clean and convenient location in the heart of downtown Eau Claire. The rooms have an industrial vibe with newspaper-style wallpaper and mini fridge in the room, semi-suite style...would have liked to have microwave as well but unfortunately there is just a fridge. Free in-room and throughout hotel wi-fi. The hotel amenities are nice, there is a Fitness Center in the basement that appears brand-new and pool as well. There are 2 computers down in lobby with a printer but in an open standing-only area so no real business center and no privacy as it is in the middle of lobby and not a separate room. No room service unfortunately but there is a small snack bar attached to the front desk. Easy convenient automatic check-out so you can just leave and receipt is emailed. 

Valet is convenient and not terribly expensive (believe it was $9/day) and they will leave your car out in front if you have to catch the 5 am flight our of Eau Claire airport.

The hotel staff is pleasant and helpful but need to be a little bit better trained, as they charged my personal credit card on 2 separate occasions instead of using the pre-paid and pre-booked card that my company booked the hotel under. Also I have to remind them every time that I am a HHonors member, even though it is always on my reservation...they never offer the Honors water and cookie and every time I have to ask for this...small thing but this brings it down a star, as any excellent rating would require that kind of service level. The staff is also not very knowledgable about the area restaurants or attractions and were unable to provide me with recommendations for a nearby run or restaurant when I asked, which I thought was odd in such a small town. There is a restaurant (The Informalist) and coffee shop (ECDC) attached to the hotel, which both very convenient and really good quality, especially the coffee shop....the restaurant menu gets tired after a few nights, as the menu is fairly small and includes a lot of pork and meat dishes so limited if you are vegetarian or  kosher/halal. Overall great convenient hotel and plan to return with my next business trip.

owner_response.author: Pete B, General Manager at The Lismore Hotel Eau Claire - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your comments on your stay at the Lismore Hotel. I appreciate any feedback as it will only help The Lismore to be the best. 
To clarify on your comments, we do have room service from 7Am-10PM 7 days a week, Our restaurant has a plethora of vegetarian entrees on the menu. 
Your comments regarding the front desk have been forwarded to the proper manager for their corrective action.

Again thank you for your comments and I look forward to your return.

Pete Bauchle
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Business trip
data.text: Nice hotel with a great restaurant and bar. Menu offers many different options for a meal. Parking does not break the bank. Hotel staff is very helpful and nice. Hotel room was smaller then most and drapes in the room did not provide the necessary privacy I would normally expect. The pull down shades did not cover the last 12-15 inches of the window.

data.title: Excellent stay at the Lismore
data.text: Was in Eau Claire for a conference and was introduced to the Lismore.  I had a great experience at this newly opened stylish hotel.  A warm cookie at check in was an expected and memorable start.  The rooms at the Lismore are spacious and hip in design and one of the most comfortable beds ever!  Great service from valet to check out, a great stay in Eau Claire!

owner_response.author: Pete B, General Manager at The Lismore Hotel Eau Claire - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review on the Lismore Hotel. We are so excited to be part of the "New Downtown Eau Claire".
It was nice to read your comments about the great service you received at The Lismore. 
I agree with you the beds are  AMAZING!

Pete Bauchle
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Big city hotel in small town Wisconsin
data.text: We stayed here one night while visiting UW campus.  We found it extremely clean and modern.  To top it off, it was cheaper than the Hampton we stayed in the previous night only 1 mile away, and Lismore was far cleaner and well kept.  We opted out of valet parking - found the municipal lot adjacent and street parking were more convenient, but YMMV.  Nice view of the city and Chippewa River from 6 floor.  Very quiet during the night, and windows have black-out shades in tracks, so the room can be completely light proof if you wish to sleep in.  Best hotel stay in past couple years or so (20+ stays).

owner_response.text:

Thank you for your comment on the black out shades as we are working on a solution.

Pete Bauchle
General Manager
Lismore Hotel
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Super clean and great downtown location
data.text:
We were in town for a family function and stayed here. In the past Eau Claire lacked hotel options however with the remodel and opening of the Lismore along with other new hotels (Holiday Inn, Hampton Inn & Oxbow) this has changed that and hopefully propels other places into improving and therefore result in competitive rates. The rate was great because I used Hilton Honors Points, still I would consider the Lismore in the future because of the downtown location, clean rooms, on-site coffee house, and The Dive Bar.

The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom had great lighting, plush towels, good-smelling toiletries. We didn't hear any noise from the hallway. We chose an odd-numbered room because another review claimed noise was a problem on the even side (from the Dive Bar outdoor area). However I don't think this would be a problem when the weather is cool as no one is outside. Our room faced downtown and the surrounding hills, it was a pretty view.

EC DC (the coffeehouse) looks out on the main street and there are several seating areas; both in the coffeehouse and also what is sort of a hotel lobby - an area with seating by a fireplace, a long table, long leather couches, and lots of individual chairs. I had a mocha and it was one of the better I have ever had, I also bought the macaroons for a hostess gift. On Sunday morning we had the family come back to the hotel for coffee and the space worked well for ages 12-85!

On Saturday night we visited the Dive Bar on the 2nd floor (the signs were slightly confusing, we didn't realize it was on the 2nd floor until the elevator opened and we saw it.) This is a cool space also with plenty of seating options. They featured some local breweries and I had a 'Farmer's Daughter' a spiced blonde ale from Lucette Brewing out of Menomonie. Generally when I'm in Wisconsin I'll have a Spotted Cow as a safe bet but I don't believe they had it on tap. I might like this one better than the cow! It was easy to talk as the music wasn't blasting and the crowd was pretty low-key.

We also liked the downtown location; we walked to several stores including my favorite antique store, The Antique Emporium. The store has a wide-range of items including items that most likely came out of some of the grand homes built with logging money. You don't have to dig through a lot of crap and it's in a cool old building.

One drawback is parking, it is $8 or 9 for in and out valet services which is pretty inexpensive. However we like to have our car 'on-hand' for stuff we keep in the car and because we were coming and going a lot. But it really wasn't an issue as there is plenty of free 2-hour parking on the surrounding streets.

There wasn't a lot of interaction with staff but where we did interact, folks were polite and efficient.

owner_response.author: Pete B, General Manager at The Lismore Hotel Eau Claire - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Wow!
Thank you for a most detailed review on the Lismore Hotel. We are so excited to be part of the "New Downtown Eau Claire".
It was nice to read your comments about the cleanliness of the room. 
I agree with you the coffee is AMAZING!

Pete Bauchle
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Downtown Minneapolis hotel that happens to be in Eau Claire
data.text: Better than we expected to find in downtown Eau Claire. Room was beautiful, bed comfortable, we had no problems at all. Nice bar and restaurant facilities, friendly staff. I hope they do well, we will be back.

We feel we have the friendliest staff around!

Pete Bauchle
General Manager

data.title: Overall nice hotel
data.text: Beds were comfortable and rooms were nicely appointed with frig, coffee, etc.  Lobby and coffee shop also were nice.  Parking situation was a little confusing.  Best option might be valet, as we couldn't figure out where the free parking was located.

owner_response.author: Pete B, General Manager at The Lismore Hotel Eau Claire - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your nice comments about The Lismore Hotel. Our rooms are getting GREAT reviews! And Yes the beds are AMAZING!
Your comments on parking were spot on and we are addressing this as we speak, although Valet is the best value. 

Thanks

Pete Bauchle
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lismore stay
data.text: Front desk and valet service was excellent. We would have rated this much higher if not for problems with the shower and electronic blinds in the room which were not immediately addressed. The upstairs dive bar was closed early so we did not have a chance to visit there we would've liked to of done that. I do have to say it was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever experienced in a hotel

owner_response.author: Pete B, General Manager at The Lismore Hotel Eau Claire - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay at the Lismore Hotel. Please accept my sincere apologies for us not exceeding your expectations. Rest assured I have shared your comments with my staff for their corrective action.
I would like to invite you back for a complimentary one night stay on your next return to Eau Claire.
You may contact me at 715-318-6466. 

Regards

Pete Bauchle
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice Modern Hotel
data.text: Very well done modern hotel with two bars and a nice restaurant.  Rooms are not large but well designed.  the bars only serve craft beers and top shelf liquor.  the restaurant is one of the best in town, for an acquired taste.  But no worries, there are numerous pubs and restaurants within walking distance.  A fairly vibrant downtown awaits!

owner_response.author: Pete B, General Manager at The Lismore Hotel Eau Claire - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for the nice comments on the Lismore Hotel. We are certainly proud of the look of the rooms. We are getting many comments on  the restaurant and I agree that it is one of the best in town.

Pete Bauchle
General Manager

data.title: Modern!
data.text: Wonderful large room with everything you need. Terrific location right downtown. Walking distance to the beautiful new Phoenix Park and many great restaurants. Stop at The Firehouse for a craft beer and enjoy the ambiance.

owner_response.text:
Thank You so much for your positive feedback on the Lismore. I will make sure to share it with my staff. It was nice to read about your comments about Eau Claire. Our location is amazing!
We are so proud of the Lismore and our staff. We feel we have the best staff in Eau Claire !


Pete Bauchle
General Manager

data.title: Great experience this time
data.text: Had a little less than perfect stay last time and everyone went out of their way to make this trip to the hotel perfect.  Special thanks to all.  Staff is super - and was very attentive to our needs.  Maids did leave a little trash in our room (actually left trash bag on the kitchen counter), but I didn't even mind that because they were all so nice and accommodating.  Loved the maids and valet staff.  Front desk was fine too. Restaurant food is still a little stuffy for my taste, but that's ok!  Good location for other restaurants in the area.  We will return.

owner_response.author: Pete B, General Manager at The Lismore Hotel Eau Claire - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for giving the Lismore a second chance. I appreciate your feedback . I will make sure I share it with he staff. 
As always I will look for your return.

Pete Bauchle
General Manager

data.title: Great location, comfy rooms
data.text: This hotel has a great location to dinner/breakfast options.  It was very clean, my room was comfortable, and the digital key was awesome- I was checked in, able to select my own room, and walked right to my room using the digital key instead of waiting in the check in line in the lobby.  Overall very pleased and I will be staying here again when I return.
